SEARCH
Module edu.ntnu.stud.boardgame
Package edu.ntnu.stud.boardgame.core.model

Class Tile

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.stud.boardgame.core.model.Tile
public class Tile extends Object
Represents a tile on the game board. Tiles have a unique ID, can have connected tiles in different directions, and can trigger actions when players land on them.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Enum of possible directions for tile connections.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile(int tileId)
      Constructs a new tile with the specified ID. The tile will initially have no connections or landing action.
      Parameters:
      tileId - The unique identifier for this tile

  • Method Details

    • getTileId

      public int getTileId()
      Gets the unique identifier for this tile.
      Returns:
      The tile ID

    • landPlayer

      public void landPlayer(Player player)
      Called when a player lands on this tile. Performs the landing action if one is set.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who landed on this tile
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is null

    • leavePlayer

      public void leavePlayer(Player player)
      Called when a player leaves this tile. Currently a placeholder for future implementation.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is leaving this tile
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is null

    • addNextTile

      public void addNextTile(Tile tile)
      Adds a tile as a forward connection to this tile. This is a convenience method for adding a tile in the FORWARD direction.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile to connect to this one
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tile is null

    • addConnectedTile

      public void addConnectedTile(Tile.Direction direction, Tile tile)
      Adds a tile as a connection in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the connection
      tile - The tile to connect to this one
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tile or direction is null

    • getConnectedTiles

      public List<Tile> getConnectedTiles(Tile.Direction direction)
      Gets the list of tiles connected to this tile in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction to get connections for
      Returns:
      A list of connected tiles in the specified direction

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this tile to another object for equality. Tiles are considered equal if they have the same ID.
